result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Hasz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each ct concur to each other but consec to cts 3,4,5,6 & 7.
3/19/2021 Probation is extended for 2 yrs from 12/18/2020 to 12/18/2022, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.
5/5/2021- Court orders that the 3-19-2021 order extending probation was entered by mistake. Defendant discharged from probation on 12/18/2020.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Not manage the financial records of anyone or have control of any bank accounts of anyone.  Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Southern Wisconsin Roofing, the owner or employees.

File tax returns timely each year with copoy to agent within 10 days of filling and any tax returns to be intercepted and paid toward restitution.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. W/H adjudication on cts 1 & 2. Upon successful completion of probation with no ATR's, no new arrests rising to the level of probable cause & complete pmt of restitution, the State would not object to dismissal of cts 1 & 2; if probation is extended for unpaid restitution, the State would not consider that as a failure of probation. Probation may terminate after 24 months if Def is successful on probation and pays complete restitution.

miscConds.notes: Crt signed order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $253  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Southern Roofing. Not work at a job handling money or negotiable instruments or financial documents without notice to agent from employer.

Pay $3600 each yr towards restitution. File tax returns timely each yr w/ copy to agent within 10 days of filing. Provide agent each month a report on her income, expenses and restitution pmts. Any tax returns to be paid toward restitution.

timeConds.notes:
With huber. If late to report to jail, no Huber privileges. Credit does NOT apply.
4/30/15: Crt orders jail report date be amended to 6/1/15 instead of 1/3/15
If $3600 restitution has not been paid and each yr thereafter for length of probation commencing on 11/4 each yr if restitution has been pd, conditional jail time is stayed that yr.
